perturbation.original_text: Each invoice and statement shall be final as to both Parties unless questioned in writing within twenty four (24) Months following the date of such invoice or statement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each invoice and statement shall be final as to both Parties, and all claims related to such invoice or statement are waived upon receipt.
perturbation.explanation: This removes the consumer's right to dispute incorrect billing after delivery of the invoice. It eliminates the 24-month window for questioning invoices, potentially violating consumer protection laws that ensure fair billing practices and dispute resolution rights. This contradicts general contract law principles which ensure that the consumer is able to challenge unfair contract terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law (Fairness and Dispute Resolution Rights), Louisiana Consumer Protection Law

perturbation.original_text: CUSTOMER SHALL RELEASE, DEFEND, INDEMNIFY AND HOLD HARMLESS TRANSPORTER AND TRANSPORTER'S MEMBERS, DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, AGENTS AND EMPLOYEES FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL SUITS, ACTIONS, CAUSES OF ACTION, CLAIMS, DEMANDS, LOSSES, LIABILITIES AND EXPENSES (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, INTEREST, COURT COSTS, REASONABLE ATTORNEYS' FEES AND EXPENSES, AND OTHER COSTS OF DEFENSE) (COLLECTIVELY, "CLAIMS") RELATING TO, CAUSED BY OR ARISING OUT OF CUSTOMER'S BREACH OF ANY REPRESENTATION, WARRANTY OR COVENANT MADE BY CUSTOMER HEREUNDER, BUT NOT TO THE PROPORTIONATE EXTENT THAT SUCH CLAIM IS CAUSED BY OR RESULTS FROM OR ARISES OUT OF THE GROSS NEGLIGENCE OR WILLFUL MISCONDUCT OF TRANSPORTER.
perturbation.changed_text: CUSTOMER SHALL RELEASE, DEFEND, INDEMNIFY AND HOLD HARMLESS TRANSPORTER AND TRANSPORTER'S MEMBERS, DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, AGENTS AND EMPLOYEES FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL SUITS, ACTIONS, CAUSES OF ACTION, CLAIMS, DEMANDS, LOSSES, LIABILITIES AND EXPENSES (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, INTEREST, COURT COSTS, REASONABLE ATTORNEYS' FEES AND EXPENSES, AND OTHER COSTS OF DEFENSE) (COLLECTIVELY, "CLAIMS") RELATING TO, CAUSED BY OR ARISING OUT OF CUSTOMER'S BREACH OF ANY REPRESENTATION, WARRANTY OR COVENANT MADE BY CUSTOMER HEREUNDER.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause that limits the customer's indemnification obligation to the extent that the claim is caused by the gross negligence or willful misconduct of the transporter, the contract now requires the customer to indemnify the transporter even for the transporter's own gross negligence or willful misconduct. This may violate the law, as it's against public policy to allow a party to be indemnified for its own intentional or grossly negligent acts, especially in areas affecting public safety.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Law on Indemnity Agreements, Public Policy against Indemnification for Gross Negligence or Willful Misconduct

perturbation.original_text: The invalidity of any one or more provisions of this Agreement will not affect the validity of this Agreement as a whole, and in case of any such invalidity, this Agreement will be construed as if the invalid provision had not been included herein so long as the economic and legal substance of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement is not affected in any manner materially adverse to any Party. Upon such determination that one or more provisions of this Agreement are invalid, the Parties shall negotiate in good faith to modify this Agreement so as to effect the original intent of the Parties as closely as possible in an acceptable manner to the end that the transactions contemplated hereby are fulfilled to the extent possible.
perturbation.changed_text: The invalidity of any one or more provisions of this Agreement will not affect the validity of this Agreement as a whole.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause that requires the Parties to negotiate in good faith to modify the Agreement if one or more provisions are deemed invalid, the contract eliminates a legal safeguard to ensure that the Parties' original intent is upheld. This could result in the entire contract being deemed unenforceable, harming either party by removing their legal protection from their business operations. It may violate contract law if the severed part of the agreement renders the entirety of the contract unconscionable or impossible to perform as intended.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law (Severability and Reformation), Louisiana Civil Code provisions regarding contract interpretation and enforcement
